title: Adam Shagash's Adyghe to English Dictionary (2021)

definitions.meaning: slightly too much; (more common in adjectives) a suffix that designates slight excessiveness, meaning, the condition of slightly going or slightly being beyond what is needed, desired, or appropriate.
dis- (Used as an intensifier of words with negative valence.)
(added to verbs) a verbal suffix that designates absolute accomplishment/realization of the action

examples.sentence: Л1ыр лажьэу егупшысагъ лэжьэ|гъахэ|мэ сыд ыш1эщтыр
examples.translation: The man while working thought what he will do after he |done| working.

definitions.meaning: (added to verbs) a verbal suffix that designates that the action was already done

examples.translation: The man while working thought what he will do after he |done| working.
The boy |already| told the girl what we studied.
I |already| told the boy what we planned.
Because I ate |already|, I am no longer hungry.

definitions.meaning: a person in the same kind/group, a person that the same feature or attribute
dis- (Used as an intensifier of words with negative valence.)
(added to verbs) a verbal suffix that designates recurrence/repetition of the verb. It can also be used to indicate an action that someone was doing before and now continuing it
(added to verbs) a verbal suffix that designates finishing/completing the verb.

(added to verbs) a verbal suffix that is used to introduce a clause or sentence which follows on in time from the first, unlike the suffix -и there is no emphasize that the second sentence happened due to the first one, rather, the emphasize is more of the time sequence

examples.translation: The boy went to the store |and| bought milk.
I shot the man with a gun |and| he started to die.
I met with my friends |and| we started to chat.
I studied for the exam |and| I did it good.
I worked a lot |and| went to eat.
The man |always| work, he doesn't rest.

examples.translation: We |always| work, let's rest for some one week.

definitions.meaning: (added to verbs) a verbal suffix that is used to introduce a clause or sentence which follows on in consequence from the first, meaning there is an emphasize that the second sentence happened because of the first and they are directly related

examples.translation: The boy fell on the ground |and| his leg got wounded.
I shot the man with a gun |and| killed him.
The house caught on fire |and| it started to burn.
I told someting to the boy |and| he gave me a response.

definitions.meaning: (added to verbs) A person that does an action indicated by the root verb; used to form an agent noun.
(added to nouns) the instrumental case (a grammatical case used to indicate that a noun is the instrument or means by or with which the subject achieves or accomplishes an action)

examples.translation: The boy is writing |with| a pencil

definitions.meaning: (added to nouns) the directional case (a grammatical case used to indicate a direction)

examples.translation: The wind is coming |from| the sea

definitions.meaning: (added to verrbs) a verbal suffix which is appended to verbs to form nouns meaning: the manner in which someone did the action
